hike_name: Cedar Grove and Vista View Point in Griffith Park
description: This hike on the southeast side of Griffith Park follows paved and unpaved trails to two park attractions, a quiet grove with a picnic area and a helipad with panoramic views
address: 2650 N Commonwealth Avenue, Los Angeles, CA 90027

hike_name: Ferndell Trail in Griffith Park
description: This relaxing hike goes through a tropical garden in the lushest little canyon in Griffith Park and can be extended to explore more of Western Canyon
address: Fern Dell Drive, Los Angeles, CA 90068

hike_name: Ferndell to Mount Hollywood Summit
description: Ferndell to Mount Hollywood Summit is a 5.2 mile heavily trafficked loop trail located near Los Angeles, California that features beautiful wild flowers and is rated as moderate.

hike_name: Ferndell Trail to the Hollywood Sign
description: Ferndell Trail to the Hollywood Sign is a 11.8 mile moderately trafficked out and back trail located near Los Angeles, California that features beautiful wild flowers and is rated as moderate.

hike_name: West Trail and Mount Hollywood Trail Loop
description: West Trail and Mount Hollywood Trail Loop is a 3 mile out and back trail located near Los Angeles, California that offers scenic views and is rated as moderate.

hike_name: Hogback Loop Trail
description: Hogback Loop Trail is a 9.5 mile heavily trafficked loop trail located near Los Angeles, California that features beautiful wild flowers and is rated as difficult.

hike_name: Griffith Observatory via East Observatory Trail in Griffith Park
description: This hike from Vermont Canyon up to Griffith Park's great observatory delivers excellent views over Los Angeles along the way
address: Vermont Canyon Road, Los Angeles, CA 90027

hike_name: Glendale Peak - Mount Hollywood Loop in Griffith Park
description: This hike visits a less known summit on the southeast side of the park with views that deserve more attention
address: North Vermont Canyon Road, Griffith Park, CA 90027

hike_name: Riverside Trail to Vista Viewpoint
description: Riverside Trail to Vista Viewpoint is a 2.4 mile heavily trafficked out and back trail located near Los Angeles, California that offers scenic views and is rated as moderate.
address: North Vermont Canyon Road, Griffith Park, CA 90027

hike_name: Griffith Observatory via West Observatory Trail in Griffith Park
description: This partial loop goes from Western Canyon up ridges to Griffith Observatory, getting sweeping views over Los Angeles and Griffith Park along the way
address: Fern Dell Drive, Los Angeles, CA 90068

hike_name: Mount Hollywood in Griffith Park - Griffith Observatory Trailhead
description: This 1,625-foot peak is a star of Griffith Park with panoramic views that can be reached from Griffith Observatory on a steep 1.4-mile hike or a scenic 2.65-mile trek and from lower in the park in Western Canyon for a hike of around 4.2 miles
address: 2800 East Observatory Road, Los Angeles, CA 90027

hike_name: Mount Hollywood in Griffith Park - Western Canyon Trailhead
description: This 1,625-foot peak is a star of Griffith Park with panoramic views that can be reached from Griffith Observatory on a steep 1.4-mile hike or a scenic 2.65-mile trek and from lower in the park in Western Canyon for a hike of around 4.2 miles
address: Western Canyon Road, Los Angeles, CA 90068

hike_name: Beacon Hill in Griffith Park
description: This out and back or loop hike climbs to the easternmost summit in the Santa Monica Mountains
address: Crystal Springs Drive & Fire Road, Los Angeles, CA 90027

hike_name: Bee Rock in Griffith Park - Merry-go-round Trailhead
description: This loop reaches a bee hive-shaped point on the east side of Griffith Park
address: Crystal Springs Drive & Fire Road, Los Angeles, CA 90027

hike_name: Bee Rock in Griffith Park - Mineral Wells Trailhead
description: This loop reaches a bee hive-shaped point on the east side of Griffith Park
address: Griffith Park Drive, Griffith Park, Los Angeles, CA 90027

hike_name: Bee Rock and Spring Canyon Loop
description: This loop reaches a bee hive-shaped point on the east side of Griffith Park

hike_name: Mineral Wells
description: Mineral Wells is a 5.2 mile moderately trafficked loop trail located near Los Angeles, California that features beautiful wild flowers and is rated as moderate.
address: Merry Go Round Lot Two, Los Angeles, CA 90027

hike_name: Griffith Observatory to the Hollywood Sign in Griffith Park
description: This hike travels from one Griffith Park landmark to another, taking a lengthy route across Mount Hollywood
address: 2800 East Observatory Road, Los Angeles, CA 90027

hike_name: Wisdom Tree, Cahuenga Peak and Mount Lee Summit Loop
description: Wisdom Tree, Cahuenga Peak and Mount Lee Summit Loop is a 3.9 mile heavily trafficked loop trail located near Los Angeles, California that features beautiful wild flowers and is rated as difficult.
address: Wonder View Trailhead, Wonder View Dr, Los Angeles, CA 90068

hike_name: Hollywood Sign and The Wisdom Tree
description: Hollywood Sign and The Wisdom Tree is a 7.6 mile heavily trafficked out and back trail located near Burbank, California that features beautiful wild flowers and is rated as difficult.
address: Mineral Wls Trl, Los Angeles, CA 90027

hike_name: Burbank Peak to Hollywood Sign to Upper Lake Hollywood Loop
description: Burbank Peak to Hollywood Sign to Upper Lake Hollywood Loop is a 5.1 mile moderately trafficked loop trail located near Los Angeles, California that offers scenic views and is rated as moderate.

hike_name: Griffith Observatory, Hollywood Sign and Cahuenga Peak
description: Griffith Observatory, Hollywood Sign and Cahuenga Peak is a 9.2 mile heavily trafficked loop trail located near Los Angeles, California that offers scenic views and is rated as difficult.

hike_name: Fern Canyon Trail
description: Fern Canyon Trail is a 3.3 mile heavily trafficked out and back trail located near Los Angeles, California that offers scenic views and is rated as moderate.
address: Merry Go Round Lot One, Los Angeles, CA 90027

hike_name: Griffith Park Hollywood Sign Trail
description: Griffith Park Hollywood Sign Trail is a 8.7 mile heavily trafficked loop trail located near Glendale, California that features beautiful wild flowers and is rated as moderate.
address: Merry Go Round Lot One, Los Angeles, CA 90027

hike_name: Mount Hollywood Trail
description: On a clear day you can see all of Los Angeles. Get there before 8am and you can park at the Observatory for free. Be aware of the heat as there is little shade on this hike. Hike early or late in the day if possible and bring lots of water.
address: Merry Go Round Lot One, Los Angeles, CA 90027

hike_name: Mount Hollywood, Mount Bell, and Mount Chapel in Griffith Park
description: This undulating loop tops three prominent summits on a panoramic tour of Griffith Park
address: 3400 N. Beachwood Drive, Los Angeles, CA 90068

hike_name: Old Zoo Picnic Area in Griffith Park
description: This short loop explores the abandoned exhibits and animal cages in the ruins of the old LA Zoo in Griffith Park
address: Griffith Park Drive, Los Angeles, CA 90027

hike_name: Griffith Park Old Zoo Loop
description: This short loop explores the abandoned exhibits and animal cages in the ruins of the old LA Zoo in Griffith Park
address: Merry Go Round Lot One, Los Angeles, CA 90027

hike_name: Brush Canyon Trail to Mount Lee and the Hollywood Sign in Griffith Park
description: This out and back hike crosses Griffith Park from Canyon Drive to the top of Mount Lee, directly behind the landmark Hollywood Sign

hike_name: Bronson Cave in Griffith Park
description: This easy out and back hike visits a man-made cave recognizable as the Batcave from the Batman TV series and hundreds of other locations on TV and film

hike_name: Hollyridge Trail to Mount Lee and the Hollywood Sign in Griffith Park
description: This out and back hike ascends from Beachwood Canyon to the summit of Mount Lee behind the Hollywood Sign

hike_name: Amir's Garden in Griffith Park
description: This out and back hike reaches a relaxing garden on the east side of Griffith Park that is a pleasant retreat for hikers
address: Mineral Wells Road, Los Angeles, CA 90027

hike_name: Amir's Garden
description: This out and back hike reaches a relaxing garden on the east side of Griffith Park that is a pleasant retreat for hikers
address: Mineral Wells Road, Los Angeles, CA 90027

hike_name: Amir's Garden via Mineral Wells Trail to North Trail
description: Amir's Garden via Mineral Wells Trail to North Trail is a 4 mile heavily trafficked out and back trail located near Los Angeles, California that features a great forest setting and is rated as moderate.

hike_name: Runyon Canyon Loops in Runyon Canyon Park
description: Tour Hollywood's most popular dog park on loops from 0.85 to 3.3 miles, getting good exercise and views over Los Angeles
address: 1854 North Fuller Avenue, Los Angeles, CA 90046

hike_name: Runyon Canyon Loops in Runyon Canyon Park - North Entrance
description: Tour Hollywood's most popular dog park on loops from 0.85 to 3.3 miles, getting good exercise and views over Los Angeles
address: Runyon Canyon North Entrance, 7317 Mulholland Drive, Los Angeles, CA 90046

hike_name: Hollywood Sign - Hollywood Reservoir Loop in Los Angeles
description: This hike combines trails and streets to visit the Hollywood Sign on Mount Lee, neighboring Cahuenga Peak and Burbank Peak, and Lake Hollywood Reservoir
address: Canyon Lake Drive, Los Angeles, CA 90068

hike_name: The Hollywood Sign via Innsdale Drive, Mulholland Highway, and Mount Lee Drive in Griffith Park
description: This hike combines trails and streets to deliver some of the very best views of the Hollywood Sign on the way to the summit of Mount Lee above the sign

hike_name: The Hollywood Sign via Innsdale Drive
description: Hollywood Sign via Innsdale Drive is a 1.7 mile moderately trafficked out and back trail located near Los Angeles, California that offers scenic views and is good for all skill levels.

hike_name: Community Trail in Kenneth Hahn State Recreation Area
description: This hike delivers views over Los Angeles from Kenneth Hahn State Recreation Area in the Baldwin Hills
address: 4100 South La Cienega Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA 90008

hike_name: Burbank Peak Trail in Griffith Park
description: This hike climbs to the Wisdom Tree perched at the west end of Griffith Park
address: Wonder View Drive & Lake Hollywood Drive, Los Angeles, CA 90068

hike_name: Cahuenga Peak and Mount Lee via Burbank Peak Trail and Aileen Getty Ridge Trail in Griffith Park
description: This out and back hike ascends a dirt single track to Cahuenga Peak and the adjacent Mount Lee, home of the Hollywood Sign
address: Wonder View Drive & Lake Hollywood Drive, Los Angeles, CA 90068

hike_name: Bantam Trail and Castair Trail in Trebek Open Space
description: This out and back hike incorporated Bantam Trail and Castair Trail in a park adjacent to Runyon Canyon
address: 2500 Nichols Canyon Road, Los Angeles, CA 90046

hike_name: Las Flores Motorway to Mount Thom in the Verdugo Mountains
description: This out and back hike follows a wide dirt road to the summit of Mount Thom, offering panoramic views from the southeast end of the Verdugo Mountains

hike_name: Beaudry Motorway Loop to Tongva Peak in the Verdugo Mountains
description: This loop climbs to the summit of Tongva Peak on the east end of the Verdugo Mountains

hike_name: Ultimate Destination Vista Point and Lookout Tower in Cherry Canyon Park
description: This hike in the San Rafael Hills rises to panoramic views at Ultimate Destination Vista Point and a summit with an old lookout tower
address: Hampstead Road, La Cañada Flintridge, CA 91011

hike_name: Fryman Canyon Loop in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This loop in the Hollywood Hills follows Betty B.  Dearing Trail through Wilacre Park and Coldwater Canyon Park

hike_name: LMU Trail (Westchester Fire Road) in Los Angeles
description: This easy hike crosses the Westchester Bluffs below the campus of Loyola Marymount University
address: 12100 West Bluff Creek Drive, Los Angeles, CA 90094

hike_name: Skyline Motorway in the Verdugo Mountains
description: This out and back hike ascends an abandoned fire road in the Verdugo Mountains with expansive views that include the skyline of downtown Los Angeles

hike_name: Hastain Trail in Franklin Canyon Park
description: This pair of short loops explore Franklin Canyon and ridges in the Santa Monica Mountains above Beverly Hills
address: Lake Drive, Franklin Canyon Park, CA 90210

hike_name: Franklin Canyon Lake Loop and Chaparral Trail in Franklin Canyon Park
description: This loop around Franklin Canyon Lake can be extended to ascend Chaparral Trail for an overview of Franklin Canyon
address: Lake Drive, Franklin Canyon Park, CA 90210

hike_name: Gabrielino Trail to Gould Mesa Trail Camp in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This hike follows the Arroyo Seco, a mountains stream, up to a trail camp just inside Angeles National Forest

hike_name: Vital Link Trail in the Verdugo Mountains
description: This extendable out and back hike ascends a steep ridge on the south side of the Verdugo Mountains with satisfying views

hike_name: Longridge Park in Sherman Oaks
description: This short hike on an undeveloped ridge in the Santa Monica Mountains has sweeping views over the San Fernando Valley

hike_name: Old Youth Camp Loop in Stough Canyon in the Verdugo Mountains
description: This lollipop loop passes the ruins of an abandoned camp in the Verdugo Mountains with views across the San Fernando Valley

hike_name: Dixie Canyon Park in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This hike forms a partial loop in a small wooded canyon on the Sherman Oaks side of the Santa Monica Mountains
address: 3500 Dixie Canyon Place, Sherman Oaks, CA 91423

hike_name: Eaton Canyon Falls in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike crosses a level park into a canyon containing a lovely 40 foot waterfall

hike_name: Gould Mesa Trail Camp from Angeles Crest Highway in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This road descends from Angeles Crest Highway to Gabrielino Trail alongside Gould Mesa Trail Camp, a hike-in campground in a canyon in Angeles National Forest
address: 5825 Angeles Crest Highway, La Cañada Flintridge, CA 91011

hike_name: Sam Merrill Trail to Echo Mountain in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike visits a historic railway and ruins from a century old resort overlooking Pasadena

hike_name: Mount Wilson Toll Road to Henninger Flats in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike ascends to a pine-covered landing in the San Gabriel Mountains with a trail camp, tree nursery, lookout tower, and visitor center operated by the Los Angeles County Fire Department

hike_name: Rubio Canyon Trail in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike ventures into a rustic canyon to a double waterfall

hike_name: Mount Lowe Road and Sunset Ridge Trail to Cape of Good Hope and Echo Mountain in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: Mount Lowe Road and Sunset Ridge Trail can be combined for a hike to a historic viewpoint called Cape of Good Hope. Follow the old route of Mount Lowe Railway to the ruins on Echo Mountain to extend the hike by two miles round trip or bring the distance up to 11.85 miles by visiting Echo Mountain, Inspiration Point, Mount Lowe Trail Camp, and other landmarks

hike_name: Millard Falls in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike visits a 50-foot waterfall up one of the most scenic canyons in the range

hike_name: Hostetter Fire Road to Verdugo Peak in the Verdugo Mountains
description: This out and back hike on the north side of the range ascends from La Tuna Canyon to the highest summit in the Verdugo Mountains
address: La Tuna Canyon Road & West La Tuna Canyon Road, Sun Valley, CA 91352

hike_name: La Tuna Canyon Trail in the Verdugo Mountains
description: This out and back hike ascends a ridge and a pair of canyons in La Tuna Canyon Park on the northwest side of the Verdugo Mountains
address: La Tuna Canyon Road, Sun Valley, CA 91352

hike_name: East Sepulveda Fire Road in Getty View Park in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This out and back hike crosses East Sepulveda Fire Road (Casiano Fire Road) on a ridge east of the 405 Freeway that offers light traffic and plentiful views of the Getty Museum and Santa Monica Bay

hike_name: Dawn Mine in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike from Millard Campground leads past Millard Falls to an old gold mine

hike_name: Castle Canyon Trail to Inspiration Point in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This trail ascends from the ruins on Echo Mountain to a historic viewpoint that still offers hike-worthy panoramas. Form a loop back to Echo Mountain to visit Mount Lowe Trail Camp, Cape of Good Hope, and other landmarks on Mount Lowe Railway

hike_name: Mount Lowe Road to Inspiration Point and Mount Lowe Trail Camp in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike descends Mount Lowe Road into the San Gabriel Mountains to a historic scenic overlook and a trail camp built on interesting ruins
address: Mount Wilson Red Box Road, Altadena, CA 91001

hike_name: Lower Canyonback Trail in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This out and back hike ascends Canyonback Ridge from Kenter Ave. in Brentwood to the Mountain Gate Country Club Estates
address: 1567 North Kenter Avenue, Los Angeles, CA 90049

hike_name: Sullivan Ridge in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This out and back hike follows a scenic 6.3-mile long ridge through the Big Wild east of Will Rogers State Park

hike_name: Sullivan Canyon in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This out and back hike follows a wide trail up the center of a sycamore-filled canyon

hike_name: Westridge Trail to San Vicente Mountain in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This out and back hike travels a scenic ridge between Brentwood and a 1,960-foot summit that was used as a Nike Missile site

hike_name: Mount Lowe Road to San Gabriel Peak in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike goes around and up San Gabriel Peak, with great views over surrounding summits including Mount Disappointment, which can also be reached
address: Mount Wilson Red Box Road, Altadena, CA 91001

hike_name: Upper Canyonback Trail in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This out and back hike descends Canyonback Ridge from Mulholland Drive to the Mountain Gate Country Club Estates

hike_name: Mandeville Canyon to San Vicente Mountain Loop in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This loop takes a DWP road up to Westridge Fire Road to visit San Vicente Mountain before crossing Mulholland Drive and Canyonback Ridge to return to Mandeville Canyon via Hollyhock Fire Road
address: 13137 Garden Land Road, Los Angeles, CA 90049

hike_name: Switzer Falls in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike starts out above and finishes below a 50-foot tall waterfall

hike_name: Upper Winter Creek Trail in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This 2.75-mile long trail can be used to extend Santa Anita Canyon Loop or create a loop with Lower Winter Creek Trail

hike_name: Santa Anita Canyon Loop in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This loop visits two peaceful creeks, a 60 foot waterfall and plenty of beautiful wilderness

hike_name: Hermit Falls in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike heads down canyon away from Sturtevant Falls toward a 30-foot waterfall. The lush canyon and the babbling creek are quite calming

hike_name: Colby Canyon Trail to Josephine Peak in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike ascends an infrequently visited canyon off Angeles Crest Highway up to a saddle below Strawberry Peak and then to a scenic summit in the front range of the San Gabriel Mountains with 360-degree over Big Tujunga Canyon and cities to the south

hike_name: Mount Zion via Lower Zion Trail in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: The leg of Santa Anita Canyon Loop ascends from Hoegees Camp to Mount Zion

hike_name: Mount Disappointment Fire Road to San Gabriel Peak in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike reaches a summit with great views over surrounding summits including Mount Disappointment, which can also be reached
address: Mount Wilson Red Box Road, Altadena, CA 91001

hike_name: Hoegees Camp via Lower Winter Creek Trail in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike follows Lower Winter Creek Trail through a wooded canyon to a trial camp with 14 first-come first-serve sites

hike_name: Mulholland Drive to San Vicente Mountain in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This out and back hike approaches the peak from the east and offers views to the north and south en route to the old Nike Missile site

hike_name: Strawberry Peak Trail in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and hike to the highest summit in the front range of the San Gabriel Mountains starts out gradual and becomes steep, presenting grand views of surrounding mountains and the cities below

hike_name: Mount Zion via Upper Zion Trail in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: The leg of Santa Anita Canyon Loop ascends from Spruce Grove Camp to Mount Zion

hike_name: Spruce Grove Camp in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike follows the canyon above Sturtevant Falls to a trail camp with 7 first-come first-serve sites

hike_name: Monrovia Falls in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike in Monrovia Canyon Park follows an enchanting canyon up to the base of the 30-foot waterfall

hike_name: Sturtevant Falls in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike visits a 60-foot waterfall and a lush cottage-lined canyon

hike_name: Trail Canyon Falls in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This hike ascends a mountain-framed canyon to a 30-foot beauty on the east side of the San Gabriel Mountains
address: 19600 North Trail Canyon Road, Tujunga, CA 91042

hike_name: Caballero Canyon Trail in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This out and back hike ascends a canyon to views over the San Fernando Valley

hike_name: Strawberry Meadow (Strawbery Potrero) in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This hike goes around Strawberry Peak to a remote and scenic flat below a massive cliff on the north side of the mountain, offering views of Big Tujunga Canyon and surrounding peaks along the way

hike_name: Vanalden Cave in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This short out and back hike visits a unique sandstone cave that you can stand inside and above. The hike can be extended to 1.55 miles round trip to visit a nearby vista point with a panoramic perspective of the Santa Monica Mountains

hike_name: Fish Canyon Falls in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike starts at a rock quarry with restricted access and ends up at a multi-tiered 80-foot waterfall

hike_name: Corbin Canyon Park in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This short partial loop offers an easy stroll along the bottom of a canyon on the north side of the Santa Monica Mountains

hike_name: Winnetka Ridge Trail in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This ridge top hike ventures into the Santa Monica Mountains from the end of Winnetka Avenue

hike_name: Viewridge Trail and Summer Hill Ranch Road in Summit Valley Edmund D. Edelman Park in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This lollipop loop in Summit Valley Edmund D. Edelman Park travels leads to Summer Hill Ranch Road and sweeping views over the Santa Monica Mountains from Canyon Overlook

hike_name: Summit Valley Edmund D. Edelman Park in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This park offers a pair of loops with views over a grassy valley in Upper Topanga Canyon
address: North Topanga Canyon Boulevard, Topanga Canyon, CA 90290

hike_name: Azusa Peak and Glendora Peak in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This 2 2/3-mile or 4 2/3-mile out and back hike ascends Garcia Trail to ""the A"" and one or two picturesque summits along Glendora Ridge Motorway

hike_name: Tuna Canyon Park in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This ocean-view packed hike explores a less-visited park between Topanga and Malibu
address: Tuna Canyon Road & Hearst Tank Motorway, Topanga Canyon, CA 90290

hike_name: Portuguese Bend Reserve on Palos Verdes Peninsula
description: This double loop explores the scenic coastal hillsides and canyons in Portuguese Bend Reserve on the Palos Verdes Peninsula and can easily be shortened to 3 miles round trip by omitting the lower loop
address: Crenshaw Boulevard & Burrell Lane, Rancho Palos Verdes, CA 90275

hike_name: Vetter Mountain in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike ascends from Charlton Flats Picnic Area to Vetter Mountain, where there are exceptional 360-degree view from the site of an old fire lookout tower

hike_name: Lunada Canyon Trail on Palos Verdes Peninsula
description: This short trail explores an overgrown canyon between two residential ridges inland of Lunada Bay
address: 2698 Vía Carrillo, Palos Verdes Estates, CA 90274

hike_name: Quarry Loop in Forrestal Nature Reserve on Palos Verdes Peninsula
description: This short loop in Forrestal Nature Reserve delivers lots of ocean views as it circles an old bowl-shaped quarry
address: 32323 Forrestal Drive, Rancho Palos Verdes, CA 90275

hike_name: Deane Dana Friendship Park on Palos Verdes Peninsula
description: This loop circles a park with panoramic ocean views over the south end of the Palos Verdes Peninsula

hike_name: Red Rock Canyon Park in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This out and back hike explores the beautifully sculpted Red Rock Canyon for between 2.5 and 5.2 miles
address: 23601 West Red Rock Road, Topanga Canyon, CA 90290

hike_name: Calabasas Peak via Calabasas Peak Motorway from Old Topanga Canyon Road in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This out and back hike on Calabasas Peak Motorway approaches Calabasas Peak from the northeast, providing big views over Topanga and other parts of the Santa Monica Mountains from a wide dirt road that leads to the 2,163-foot summit
address: Old Topanga Canyon Road, Topanga, CA 90290

hike_name: Summit to Summit Motorway in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This mostly unpaved road crosses a scenic ridge between the high points of Old Topanga Canyon Road and Topanga Canyon Boulevard
address: Old Topanga Canyon Road, Topanga, CA 90290

hike_name: Topanga Lookout in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This out and back hike visits the site of an old fire tower which still offers great views of the surrounding mountains
address: 23300 Saddle Peak Road, Topanga Canyon, CA 90290

hike_name: Seascape Trail on Palos Verdes Peninsula
description: This level family-friendly hike explores scenic coastal bluffs north of the historic Point Vicente Lighthouse on Palos Verdes Peninsula
address: Pacifica Del Mar, Rancho Palos Verdes, CA 90275

hike_name: Calabasas Peak via Calabasas Peak Motorway from Stunt Road in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This out and back hike on Calabasas Peak Motorway approaches Calabasas Peak from the south, ascending through sandstone formations to panoramic views of the Santa Monica Mountains and San Fernando Valley

hike_name: White Point Nature Preserve on Palos Verdes Peninsula
description: This loop on Palos Verdes Peninsula explores an open space containing a military bunker built to defend the west coast during World War II
address: 1600 West Paseo Del Mar, San Pedro, CA 90731

hike_name: Mount Hillyer in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike reaches a 6,215-foot summit above Horse Flats Campground with panoramic mountain views

hike_name: Calabasas Peak via Calabasas – Cold Creek Trail in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This out and back hike starts up a scenic single track formerly know as the Secret Trail to reach the summit

hike_name: Carbon Canyon Nature Trail to the Redwood Grove in Carbon Canyon Regional Park
description: This level hike (out and back or loop) visits a small grove of small coastal redwoods in Carbon Canyon Regional Park, the largest grove of these large trees in Southern California

hike_name: Calabasas Stairs in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This hike leads to a long flight of stairs off Anza Loop Trail (add 0.2 miles for each extra trip up and down the steps)

hike_name: Twin Peaks and Mount Waterman in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This hike extends a loop over Mount Waterman to ascend Twin Peaks, a panoramic summit at the center of the San Gabriel Mountains

hike_name: Cave of Munits in Upper Las Virgenes Canyon Open Space Preserve & Castle Peak in El Escorpion Park
description: This action-packed two-attraction loop crosses through an impressive cave to climb to a rocky peak with views over the San Fernando Valley
address: 24501 West Vanowen Street, West Hills, CA 91307

hike_name: Los Pinetos Waterfall via Canyon Trail & Waterfall Trail in Placerita Canyon Natural Area
description: This out and back hike in Placerita Canyon Natural Area follows Canyon Trail to the ruins of Walker Ranch and Waterfall Trail to an elusive falls in a sylvan canyon

hike_name: Ecology Trail in Placerita Canyon Natural Area
description: This lollipop loop in Placerita Canyon Natural Area will introduce you to numerous local plants along with views of Placerita Canyon

hike_name: Anza Loop Trail in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This hike follows a historic route through rolling hills in Calabasas south of the 101 Freeway

hike_name: Rocky Peak in the Santa Susana Mountains
description: This out and back hike climbs to a 2,715-foot summit in Rocky Peak Park in the Santa Susana Mountains between Chatsworth and Simi Valley
address: Rocky Peak Road, Simi Valley, CA 93063

hike_name: Las Virgenes View Trail in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This hike patiently weaves its way across hills along Las Virgenes Road and rises up a canyon to ridgetop views over Malibu Creek State Park and mountains in Calabasas

hike_name: Winston Ridge and Winston Peak in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This partial loop bags a summit and a scenic ridge in the high San Gabriel Mountains

hike_name: Mount Waterman in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This summit can be reached on an out and back hike or a loop, passing through a pine forest to reach a round mountaintop. Add six miles to the hike by dropping across a saddle and climbing to the top of Twin Peaks

hike_name: Towsley View Loop Trail in Ed Davis Park in Towsley Canyon
description: This loop explores two canyons and scenic ridges in the Santa Susana Mountains, passing the narrows of Towsley Gorge in Towsley Canyon

hike_name: Lake Huntington in Huntington Beach Central Park
description: This level and easy loop circles a small lake in Huntington Beach Central Park

hike_name: Cooper Canyon Falls in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike leaves from Buckhorn Campground and visits a short waterfall in an enchanting glen of tall pines

hike_name: Smith Mountain via Upper Bear Creek Trail in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike follows a gradual trail to a steep scramble to a 5,111 foot summit with panoramic views over the San Gabriel Mountains
address: San Gabriel Canyon Road, Azusa, CA 91702

hike_name: Corral Canyon Loop in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This loop offers ocean and canyon views from a unspoiled section of the Santa Monica Mountains in Malibu

hike_name: Heartbreak Hill Trail in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This hike offers a condensed workout, shooting up a ridge to a panoramic crest in the Santa Monica Mountains

hike_name: Solstice Canyon in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This out and back is easy and level, and visits the ruins of a burned down ranch and a small waterfall

hike_name: Crystal Lake in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This short paved hike visits the only naturally occurring lake in the San Gabriel Mountains

hike_name: Castro Crest from Corral Canyon Road through Upper Solstice Canyon in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This out and back hike crosses remote Upper Solstice Canyon from Corral Canyon Road to Castro Crest

hike_name: Paramount Ranch in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This loop explores Western Town, an outdoor set used for frontier towns in TV and film, and sorrounding hills in the Santa Monica Mountains

hike_name: Bridge to Nowhere in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This adventurous out and back hike requires several river crossings to reach an out-of-place bridge with a unique history

hike_name: Pacific Crest Trail and Foot Trail Loop in Vasquez Rocks Natural Area Park
description: This loop offers a dose of desert hiking close to LA, incorporating a piece of the Pacific Crest Trail to explore striking sandstone formations that are frequently used as movie backdrops
address: 10700 West Escondido Canyon Road, Agua Dulce, CA 91350

hike_name: Escondido Falls in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This out and back visits a 200-foot waterfall that is split into two tiers. The upper tier is 150 feet tall and stunning after a rainstorm

hike_name: Castro Crest from Latigo Canyon Road in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This out and back hike crosses a green canyon and climbs to a scenic saddle below Castro Peak

hike_name: Heaton Flats Trail in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike starts from the same trailhead as the Bridge to Nowhere and climbs toward Iron Mountain and panoramic views

hike_name: China Flat and Simi Peak in the Simi Hills
description: This hike ventures up rugged ridges to a peaceful oak savanna and a trail to the highest point in the Simi Hills, sporting 360-degree views of surrounding mountain ranges
address: 1400 King James Court, Oak Park, CA 91377

hike_name: Zuma Canyon Ocean View Trail - Canyon View Trail loop in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This loop demands more effort than the Zuma Canyon Trail and provides great ocean and canyon views

hike_name: Weir Canyon Trail in Weir Canyon Wilderness Park in Santiago Oaks Regional Park
description: This loop explores the side of a canyon in a wilderness connected to Santiago Oaks Regional Park near Anaheim
address: South Hidden Canyon Road, Anaheim, CA 92807

hike_name: Zuma Canyon Trail in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This out and back hike leaves a coastal Malibu neighborhood to explore rustic Zuma Canyon

hike_name: Rocky Oaks Park in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This short and easy hike visits a pond and a scenic overlook in a small parcel of Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area

hike_name: Zuma Ridge Trail in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This wide dirt service road weaves northwest up the back of the ridge west of Zuma Canyon to access to several trails in the area
address: Zuma Ridge Motorway & Busch Drive, Malibu, CA 90265

hike_name: Lake View Loop & East Ridge Overlook in Peters Canyon Regional Park
description: This figure eight loop adds a short extension to Lake View Loop to reach the high point of Peters Canyon Regional Park
address: Peters Canyon Regional Park, Orange, CA 92869

hike_name: West Bluff Trail Loop in Upper Newport Bay Nature Preserve
description: This loop combines trails above and below the West Bluff in Upper Newport Bay Nature Preserve to provide a variety of views across Upper Newport Bay

hike_name: Mount Baden-Powell in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike climbs to one of the tallest summits in the San Gabriel Mountains and a monument to Lord Baden-Powell, a BSA icon and the founder of the Scout Movement

hike_name: Charmlee Wilderness Park in Malibu
description: This loop is one of several possible hikes in this bluff-top park with ocean views over Malibu

hike_name: Arroyo Sequit in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This winding loop explores the upper reaches of a canyon carved by the East Fork of Arroyo Sequit and has grand views of the Santa Monica Mountains

hike_name: Icehouse Canyon to Icehouse Saddle in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike travels through a picturesque canyon to a saddle with panoramic views and extended hiking opportunities
address: 7698 Ice House Canyon Road, Mount Baldy, CA 91759

hike_name: Angel Vista via West Los Robles Trail in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This out and back hike offers a more gradual route to the overlook on the north side of the Santa Monica Mountains

hike_name: Oak Creek Canyon Loop Trail in Los Robles Open Space
description: This loop starts with an all-access nature trail with signs in English and Braille before transitioning to a less developed dirt single track, looping through chaparral and oak woodlands in Los Robles Open Space

hike_name: Mount Baldy in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This loop incorporates Devil's Backbone and Baldy Bowl - Ski Hut Trail to reach the highest summit in the San Gabriel Mountains
address: Mount Baldy Road & Falls Road, Mount Baldy, CA 91759

hike_name: San Antonio Falls in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike on a paved road visits a multi-tier waterfall below Mount Baldy
address: Mount Baldy Road & Falls Road, Mount Baldy, CA 91759

hike_name: Tarantula Hill in Thousand Oaks
description: This out and back hike follows a paved trail to the top of a small, round hill in Thousand Oaks with views across the Conejo Valley into the surrounding mountains

hike_name: Mount Baldy via Baldy Bowl – Ski Hut Trail in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This out and back hike offers a steep but scenic ascent up the south side of Mount Baldy
address: Mount Baldy Road & Falls Road, Mount Baldy, CA 91759

hike_name: Mount Baldy via Devil's Backbone Trail in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: This ridge-top trail between Baldy Notch and the summit of Mount Baldy offers incredible views of the San Gabriel Mountains
address: Mount Baldy Road & Falls Road, Mount Baldy, CA 91759

hike_name: Angel Vista via Rosewood Trail in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This out and back hike is the most direct route to a panoramic viewpoint overlooking the Conejo Valley

hike_name: Baldy Notch in the San Gabriel Mountains
description: To hike the scenic Devil's Backbone to Mount Baldy, you must pass through Baldy Notch. You can hike to the notch, or take a ski lift
address: 1199 Mount Baldy Road, Mount Baldy, CA 91759

hike_name: Lizard Rock in Wildwood Park
description: Loop to an interesting rock outcropping by adding extra mileage and views to a visit to Paradise Falls in Thousand Oaks
address: 928 West Avenida De Los Arboles, Thousand Oaks, CA 91360

hike_name: Paradise Falls in Wildwood Park
description: Several trails can be used to reach a 40-foot waterfall in Wildwood Park in Thousand Oaks, forming a loop
address: 928 West Avenida De Los Arboles, Thousand Oaks, CA 91360

hike_name: Nicholas Flat Trail - Willow Creek Trail Loop to Ocean Vista in Leo Carrillo State Park
description: This loop in Leo Carrillo State Park wraps around a coastal ridge and tops out at an ocean vista with broad views
address: 35000 West Pacific Coast Highway, Malibu, CA 90265

hike_name: Sandstone Peak in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This loop summits the tallest peak in the Santa Monica Mountains

hike_name: The Grotto in the Santa Monica Mountains
description: This out and back hike visits a remote grotto in the Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area

hike_name: Fish Canyon Narrows in the Sierra Pelona Mountains
description: This out and back hike explores an enchanting narrow canyon in the Sierra Pelona Mountains north of Santa Clarita

hike_name: Santa Paula Canyon Trail to the Punchbowl in Santa Paula & Los Padres National Forest
description: This hike ventures up rugged Santa Paula Canyon to a waterfall and a Punchbowl of pools and cascades in Santa Paula Creek by Big Cone Camp
address: North Ojai Road, Santa Paula, CA 93060

hike_name: El Cariso Nature Trail in the Santa Ana Mountains
description: This loop examines common plants in the Santa Ana Mountains, along with uncommon views views across the mountain range, passing an old mine for more fun

hike_name: Marshall Peak in the San Bernardino Mountains
description: This hike reaches a panoramic summit above the foothills of the San Bernardino Mountains
address: Rim of the World Highway, San Bernardino, CA 92404

hike_name: Ortega Falls in the Santa Ana Mountains
description: This out and back hike visits a refreshing waterfall, cascade, and swimming hole off Ortega Highway in the Santa Ana Mountains

hike_name: Heart Rock in the San Bernardino Mountains
description: This hike follows a mountain stream to an overlook of an amazing heart-shaped formation in the rock wall along Seeley Creek Falls

hike_name: Sisar Canyon Trail in Santa Paula & Los Padres National Forest
description: This hike travels up a canyon to a viewpoint in the Topatopa Mountains between Ojai and Santa Paula

hike_name: Sespe Creek to Willett Hot Springs in Los Padres National Forest
description: This out and back hike in the Sespe Wilderness of Los Padres National Forest follows Sespe Creek to a relaxing hot springs

hike_name: Tenaja Falls in the Santa Ana Mountains
description: This hike ventures up a wilderness canyon to a tall, five-tier waterfall along San Mateo Creek in the Santa Ana Mountains

hike_name: Horn Canyon Trail in Ojai & Los Padres National Forest
description: This hike goes up a canyon in the frontcountry of the Topatopa Mountains and ventures off trail along the soothing waters of Thacher Creek

hike_name: Rose Valley Falls in Los Padres National Forest
description: This out and back hike leads to the lower tier of this two-tier 300 foot waterfall. From there one can scramble off trail to the much taller upper tier
address: Rose Valley Lake Road, Ojai, CA 93023

hike_name: Heaps Peak Arboretum in the San Bernardino Mountains
description: Take a short hike on Sequoia Trail and Footprint Trail to learn about the plants, animals, and natural history
address: Heaps Peak Arboretum Day Use Area, Crestline, CA 92385

hike_name: Wheeler Gorge Campground and Nature Trail in Los Padres National Forest
description: This loop explores the creek and forest on a nature trail around a 70-site campground in Los Padres National Forest

hike_name: Carpinteria Bluffs Trail to Carpinteria Seal Sanctuary Overlook in Carpinteria Bluffs Nature Preserve
description: This out and back hike goes from Carpinteria Bluffs Nature Preserve to a beach and a viewing area above a harbor seal rookery

hike_name: Monserate Mountain in Fallbrook
description: This loop begins with a 1 2/3-mile ascent to a panoramic summit before descending along a ridge for even more views

hike_name: Towne Trail in Big Bear Lake
description: This easy out and back hike takes a gradual course across the mountains on the south side of Big Bear Lake
address: Thrush Drive, Big Bear Lake, CA 92315

hike_name: Ennisbrook Trail in San Ysidro Creek Preserve in Montecito
description: This easy lollipop loop crosses charming stone bridges over San Ysidro Creek to explore a lush oak forest that is flooded by nasturtiums in the spring

hike_name: McMenemy Overlook Trail in the Los Padres National Forest
description: This hike uses four trails to form a loop to a vista point in the Santa Ynez Mountains behind Montecito

hike_name: Montecito Peak in Los Padres National Forest
description: This partial loop climbs to a panoramic summit in Los Padres National Forest overlooking Montecito and Santa Barbara

hike_name: Tangerine Falls in Los Padres National Forest
description: This out and back hike crosses a lush canyon to a beautiful waterfall on the edge of Los Padres National Forest near Santa Barbara

hike_name: Indian Mountain in the San Jacinto Mountains
description: This out and back hike crosses a saddle to a 5,790-foot summit with views of the mountains around San Jacinto Peak near Idyllwild

hike_name: Inspiration Point via Tunnel Trail and Jesusita Trail from Tunnel Road in Santa Barbara
description: This out and back hike combines Tunnel Trail and Jesusita Trail to ascend Mission Canyon to a sweeping viewpoint that looks down over Santa Barbara and up into the Santa Ynez Mountains

hike_name: Inspiration Point via Jesusita Trail from San Roque Road in Santa Barbara
description: This out and back hike up Jesusita Trail reaches a panoramic viewpoint in the Santa Ynez Mountains overlooking Santa Barbara
address: 1150 San Roque Road, Santa Barbara, CA 93105

hike_name: Canyon View Loop Trail in Whitewater Preserve
description: This loop crosses Whitewater River and incorporates a section of the Pacific Crest Trail to deliver big views up and down Whitewater Canyon on the east end of the San Bernardino Mountain

hike_name: Ernie Maxwell Scenic Trail in the San Jacinto Mountains
description: This gradual out and back hike near Idyllwild crosses quiet forests with rugged mountain views

hike_name: Observatory Trail in Cleveland National Forest
description: The out and back hike travels between Observatory Campground and Palomar Observatory, crossing a pleasant mountain woodland with valley views along the way
address: South Grade Road, Palomar Mountain, CA 92060

hike_name: Knapp's Castle in Santa Barbara
description: This easy hike visits the scenic ruins of an estate home built atop the mountains behind Santa Barbara
address: East Camino Cielo, Santa Barbara, CA 93105

hike_name: Lizard's Mouth in Los Padres National Forest
description: This short out and back hike visits a unique rock formation with amazing views over Santa Barbara and the Pacific
address: West Camino Cielo (Forest Route 5N12), Los Padres National Forest, Santa Barbara, CA 93105
